meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect (something) from a link or chain.
meanings.sent1: I need to delink the old chain from the swing.
meanings.sent2: Please delink the necklace from the bracelet.
meanings.sent3: It was like a magic trick when I delinked the paperclip from the chain.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to delink the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she delinked the key from the keychain.

meanings.definition: To remove a hyperlink from a webpage.
meanings.sent1: Can you delink the broken link from the website?
meanings.sent2: The web developer needs to delink the outdated URL.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally delinked the important link, oops!
meanings.sent4: The virus managed to delink all the hyperlinks on the page.
meanings.sent5: She had to delink the incorrect URL to fix the webpage.

meanings.definition: To break or sever a connection or relationship.
meanings.sent1: The storm delinked the power lines, causing a blackout.
meanings.sent2: They decided to delink their business partnership.
meanings.sent3: The magician delinked the chains in a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: The argument delinked their friendship, leaving them estranged.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake delinked the bridge, cutting off the town from the city.
